Course Description:
THE STUDY OF ACCOUNTING TERMINOLOGY, CONCEPTS, TECHNIQUES, METHODS,
PRINCIPLES, PRACTICES AND PROCEDURES AS APPLIED TO SOLE
PROPRIETORSHIPS.  TYPICAL FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS ARE ANALYZED IN
RELATION TO THE BASIC ACCOUNTING EQUATION AND RECORDED IN THE BOOKS
OF BUSINESS.  BUSINESS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE PREPARED AND
INTERPRETED BY THE STUDENT.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:

DISCUSS ACCOUNTING AS AN INFORMATION SYSTEM.
DESCRIBE THE DOUBLE-ENTRY SYSTEM.
DEMONSTRATE AN UNDERSTANDING OF ACCRUAL-BASIS ACCOUNTING AND
THE MATCHING PRINCIPLE.
Textbook(s): PRINCIPLES OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, 17TH ED., LARSON, IBSN: 0-07-365390-0
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
